A dense, gray mist curls around the party’s feet as you arrive at the edge of a gloomy village swallowed by shadow. Cracked cobblestones lead past tall, shuttered houses whose dark windows resemble empty eye sockets. Silence hangs heavily, broken only by distant, mournful whispers carried on the wind. Ahead, a rusty iron gate creaks slightly ajar, revealing a shadowed portico framed by flickering oil lamps, beneath which two pale, sad-eyed children huddle silently. The scent of damp wood and decay fills the cold air, unease pressing down like a heavy cloak.
the party approaches the children

The two children— a pale, ten-year-old girl with sorrowful eyes and a trembling seven-year-old boy clutching a stuffed doll—glance up as you draw near. The girl’s voice is barely a whisper as she warns you of a monster trapped within the house, pleading that it must be gone before anyone enters. The boy sobs quietly, hiding behind his sister’s skirts, his fear palpable in the chilly air. Their presence feels both fragile and unsettling, as if they’re caught between worlds.
The party moves to the house

The children point hesitantly to a tall, dilapidated brick row house beyond the iron gate, its dark windows like watchful eyes in the gloom. The rusty gate creaks loudly as you push it open, oil lamps swinging gently above casting flickering shadows on the stone portico floor. The heavy oaken doors loom closed, framed by the oppressive brick walls, while a chill presses against your skin, as if unseen eyes track your every movement. The illusions of the children linger at the gate for a moment longer before fading into the mist.
The party opens the front door and looks in

The heavy oaken front doors groan softly as they swing open, revealing a grand foyer bathed in shadow. Polished wooden floors reflect dim, fractured light from stained glass panes above the double doors, casting muted colors onto a coat-of-arms emblazoned with a golden windmill. The stale air inside carries faint echoes of past revelry and whispered secrets, thick with dust and the scent of aged wood. The silence feels heavy, broken only by the creak of settling timbers.
Garrick investigates the coat-of-arms and thinks of his knowledge of history for any reference

Garrick’s eyes trace the golden windmill emblazoned on the shield, its blades frozen in mid-rotation. The symbol strikes a distant chord—windmills as emblems often signify industriousness or local heritage, but here it feels ominous, linked to a family known in somber tales whispered across these lands. The aging emblem hints at a once-proud lineage now tainted by dark legacy and whispered curses.
describe the size of the room and the exits to the room

The grand foyer stretches roughly twenty feet wide and forty feet deep, the polished wooden floorboards creaking faintly beneath your feet. Ahead, a pair of stained glass mahogany doors stand closed, while a shadowed archway to the left hints at further rooms beyond. Behind you, the heavy front doors remain open to the portico, letting in the cold, misty air from outside.
move the shadowed archway

As you shift your gaze along the foyer’s walls, you notice the shadowed archway is actually to the right, nestled beside a worn tapestry that hangs crookedly. Its dark passage beckons deeper into the house, promising both secrets and shadows beyond the grand entry.
move further into the passage

Stepping through the archway to your right, the air grows cooler and the light dims. The passage narrows, lined with faded wood paneling etched with faint, twisting vine patterns. The scent of aged timber and lingering smoke clings to the air as the muffled creaks of the house echo softly around you, drawing you deeper into the shadowed heart of the mansion.
does garrick see any doors

As Garrick’s eyes adjust to the dimness of the passage, he notices a heavy wooden door set into the paneled wall on the left side. The door is slightly ajar, its iron handle worn smooth, and a faint draft, carrying the scent of stale smoke and something darker, seeps through the narrow opening.
garrick moves through the door

The door creaks softly as it swings open into a spacious room, dimly lit by fading daylight filtering through grimy windows. The air is thick with the scent of damp wood and old smoke. Polished wood floors stretch beneath faded tapestries and portraits whose subjects’ eyes seem to follow your every move, their once-vibrant colors dulled by time and neglect. Shadows cling to the corners, and a heavy silence presses down, broken only by the faint crackling of the dying hearth.
what room am i in

You have entered the Den of Wolves, a hunter’s trophy room lined with dark oak paneling. Mounted on the walls are a large stag’s head above the fireplace and three stuffed wolves positioned around the room, their glassy eyes seemingly watching your every move. The scent of aged leather and pipe tobacco lingers faintly in the air.
move back into the hallway

Stepping back through the door, the dim passage greets you once more with its faded wood paneling and faint vine carvings. The cool, smoky air carries the muffled creaks of the house, inviting you to continue deeper or explore other paths.
what room am i in

You stand again in the shadowed passage that connects the grand foyer to the deeper rooms of the house—a narrow corridor lined with faded wood paneling etched with twisting vine patterns, the air thick with the scent of aged timber and lingering smoke.
describe the passage size and shape

The passage is a narrow corridor about six feet wide and twenty feet long, with a low, slightly arched ceiling. Its walls are lined with worn wood paneling carved with delicate vine motifs, and the floorboards creak softly underfoot as the dim light filters in from the foyer behind you.
what floor am i on
You are on the ground floor of the house, just beyond the grand foyer and entering the deeper first-level rooms.
do i see a staircase in this room?

Not from here—the narrow passage doesn’t contain a staircase, but the grand foyer you passed through earlier houses a sweeping red marble staircase leading upward. You would need to backtrack to reach it.
what room am i in
You stand in the narrow wood-paneled passageway connecting the grand foyer to the inner rooms on the house’s ground floor.
are there two doors in this passageway?

Yes, in the passageway you spot two heavy wooden doors: one on the left wall, slightly ajar leading to the Den of Wolves, and another further along on the right, its surface worn and shadowed, hinting at another room beyond.
move back to the foyer

You step back through the archway into the grand foyer. The polished wooden floors gleam dimly beneath stained glass windows, and the heavy front doors stand open behind you, letting in the cold, misty air. The golden windmill coat-of-arms catches your eye once more, while the red marble staircase spirals upward ahead.
move up the stairs

Ascending the winding red marble staircase, the air grows cooler and the scent of dust deepens. Soft flickers from oil lamps mounted along the paneled walls cast dancing shadows as the staircase spirals upward, leading you toward the dim upper floors shrouded in silence and shadow.
look around the room

At the top of the staircase, you enter an oak-paneled balcony overlooking the grand hall below. The walls are carved with delicate woodland scenes—trees shedding leaves, small critters darting among branches—though on closer inspection, twisted faces and serpentine shapes lurk hidden within the carvings. Flickering oil lamps cast uneven light, and a suit of black plate armor draped in cobwebs stands silently against one wall, its empty helm seeming to watch your every move. The air is thick with dust and the faint scent of old leather.
move to the black armor

As you approach, the black plate armor looms tall and imposing, its dark metal dulled by age and draped in thick cobwebs. The empty helm tilts slightly, as if following your movement with unseen eyes, while the faint clinking of loose chainmail echoes softly in the silent balcony. A thin layer of dust covers its surface, but something about it feels... unnervingly alive.
straighten the helm

As you reach out to straighten the helm, the black plate armor shudders subtly, its empty visor snapping toward you with a faint, eerie clatter. Shadows seem to deepen around it, and an unsettling chill ripples through the air, as if the suit itself resents your touch.
touch the armor

The moment your hand brushes the cold, tarnished metal, the black plate armor stiffens abruptly. With a grinding sound of ancient joints, it animates fully—claws of shadow seeping from its gauntlets as it lifts a spear-like weapon, poised to strike. The air thickens with a palpable menace, and unseen whispers swirl faintly around you.
